image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing a suit and a red gown speaks on a podium inside a brick building

props.synopsis: A Sydney court rules in favour of Local Government Minister Ron Hoenig allowing him to suspend councillors and appoint an administrator from September 5.

title.children: Liverpool Council loses legal bid to stop investigation into its operations

image.altText: Sydney To Hobart competitor Spirit Of Mateship crosses Storm Bay en route to Hobart, December 29, 2014.

props.synopsis: A major rescue mission is underway roughly 150 kilometres off the New South Wales south coast where two people are stuck on a yacht taking on water.

title.children: Two people on board stricken yacht off NSW coast

image.altText: Bridgette Porter who was killed by her cousin is covered in a red blanket while sitting on her mother's lap

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of people are supporting Biddy Porter's parents' fight for greater justice for their murdered daughter. Now NSW MPs will be asked for their support.

title.children: Parents' petition for murdered schoolgirl triggers parliamentary debate

image.altText: Two men walking. Leonard Albert Gardiner is on the right.

props.synopsis: Leonard Albert Gardiner, now 87, will remain in prison until at least October 2030 after being found guilty of maintaining an unlawful relationship with a child aged under 16 and committing an act of buggery.

title.children: Former teacher jailed for abusing students at prestigious private school

image.altText: Aerial thermal imaging of  a bushfire.

props.synopsis: The NSW Rural Fire Service has worked against the clock to contain an out-of-control grass fire as strong wind gusts have fanned blazes across the greater Sydney area.

title.children: Out-of-control grass fire burns near gas storage plant north of Newcastle

image.altText: Composite image of CCTV of missing woman

props.synopsis: Queensland Police say Jamilla Humphrey, 52, may have walked off from her car in remote bushland possibly looking for help after becoming bogged.

title.children: Missing NSW woman's van found bogged on Cape York Peninsula road

image.altText: Dubbo Courthouse

props.synopsis: Gino Margiotta will remain behind bars for sexually assaulting a woman while travelling 13 years ago, an incident she says broke her "heart and trust".

title.children: South Australian man jailed for historical sexual assault in NSW

image.altText: Military Rd site aerial view

props.synopsis: A vacant copper smelter site at Port Kembla is up for sale but the operator says at least 300 homes nearby still have heavy metal contamination.

title.children: Decades of pollution leave legacy of contamination in beachside suburb

image.altText: Ryley Batt of Australia in action against Japan. With the ball, wheeling down court

props.synopsis: Australia's men's wheelchair rugby team has the chance to take some hardware home from Paris, taking on Great Britain in the bronze medal match. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: Steelers bid for Paralympic wheelchair rugby bronze against Great Britain

image.altText: A teenage girl wearing glasses in a classroom.

props.synopsis: Two systems, one huge problem. Tasmanian children are being failed by a dual purpose education system that seems to suit no one.

title.children: Just over half of this state's kids finish Year 12. The system is 'failing' them

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek staring at an out of focus Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: The federal government has signalled it is willing to make its proposed environmental protection agency more business-friendly, in a major concession designed to win Coalition support that environment groups have branded a "betrayal."

title.children: PM offers to water down planned environmental watchdog to secure Coalition support

image.altText: People help an injured man walk in the middle of rubble

props.synopsis: Kyiv officials report a series of explosions as Moscow launches a strike against the Ukrainian capital, sending residents fleeing into bomb shelters.

title.children: Russia launches barrage of drones, cruise and ballistic missiles at Kyiv

image.altText: Protesters march on a street holding a banner that reads "Fascism is not an opinion, it's a crime" in German.

props.synopsis: An election in the little-known German state of Thuringia has been thrust into the global spotlight after seeing a far-right nationalist party win for the first time since World War Two.

title.children: A far-right party has won a state election in Germany for the first time since Nazi rule. Here's what it means

image.altText: A bald man in a Hawaiian shirt standing in front of a tree.

props.synopsis: Ashley Paul Griffith was arraigned on more than 300 charges in the District Court in Brisbane today.

title.children: 'Room of horrors': Family of abused child in court as daycare paedophile Ashley Paul Griffith pleads guilty

image.altText: A woman wearing a blue jacket and black top walks down a street

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds did not always believe Brittany Higgins had been raped and even attempted to "smear" her former staffer to cast doubt on her credibility, a court has been told.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann buying Brittany Higgins a coffee was used as an attempt to besmirch her, defamation trial told

image.altText: Unidentifiable domestic violence victim on the phone.

props.synopsis: The Minns government will introduce new offences, court orders and other changes in a bid to address gaps in the state's domestic, family and sexual violence legislation.

title.children: Domestic violence offenders 'deserve' to be treated like the 'worst criminals', NSW Attorney-General says

image.altText: A giant seawall next to a beach.

props.synopsis: The National Parks and Wildlife Service closed Shark Beach in Nielsen Park in early 2022, after its 100-year-old seawall was damaged in a storm six years earlier. The reopening of the beach has been delayed again after the NPWS identified defects.

title.children: 'All a bit fed up': Residents locked out of iconic Sydney beach since 2022 have longer to wait

image.altText: Dreamworld logo sign at entrance to the theme park on Queensland's Gold Coast.

props.synopsis: An experienced animal handler has been hospitalised with serious lacerations and puncture wounds to her arm and shoulder.

title.children: Woman hospitalised after being bitten by tiger at Dreamworld

image.altText: Water rushes down a channel down a hill, with white water at the base

props.synopsis: Tasmania continues to be hammered by wild weather, with thousands of people left without electricity and a major flood peak expected this evening, as Victorians inundate the SES calls for help. Follow live.

title.children: Thousands without power in Victoria, Tasmania prepares for record flooding peak

image.altText: A footballer in clear pain walks off the field with the assistance of two trainers.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Roosters are facing an injury crisis on the eve of the NRL finals that has the potential to last long into the 2025 season.

title.children: Roosters stars Walker and Smith officially out for the season in double blow ahead of finals

image.altText: Man in orange shirt in front of fence with arms crossed

props.synopsis: A Kimberley man who helps rehabilitate family and domestic violence perpetrators says he has had fewer referrals since liquor restrictions were introduced, as the state government reports an "almost immediate" drop in violence.

title.children: 'Almost immediate' drop in domestic and family violence rates since alcohol restrictions introduced

image.altText: A teenage boy in formal wear standing in an event hall with white chairs and cake

props.synopsis: The brother of 17-year-old boy Mehdi Habibi, who went missing in waters off Victor Harbor, has detailed the moments before the teenager fell from rocks during a family gathering at the popular tourist spot.

title.children: Missing teen's anguished family say he was posing for photo when he was swept off rocks

image.altText: Donald Trump yelling.

props.synopsis: Plus, cartoonist Michael Leunig says 'goodbye, mainstream media', Oasis fans upset over Ticketmaster's 'dynamic pricing' and Adele announces an indefinite break.

title.children: Trump campaign says biographical film belongs in a 'dumpster fire' after release date confirmed

image.altText: Adam Liaw sits next to Shaun Micallef on the set of Shaun Micallef's Eve of Destruction

props.synopsis: When cook, writer and broadcaster Adam Liaw was given a portrait of his ancestor as a gift, it revealed his link to a criminal whose name and crimes are known around the world.

title.children: Adam Liaw's unlikely connection to one of London's most notorious criminals

image.altText: For sale sign outside an apartment building along a street in Brisbane on October 31, 2018.

props.synopsis: Australian house prices have continued to rise, but the real estate market is showing signs of slowing, according to new data.

title.children: What August's house price data tells us about where values are headed

image.altText: A bare-chested man sitting in a chair, leaning abck with his eyes closed.

props.synopsis: Heatwaves loom as a growing threat to humanity in a warming climate. This summer alone, in the northern hemisphere, thousands have died during extreme heat events. It's driving researchers to find out more about the point when heat turns deadly.

title.children: For the first time, humans were exposed to a deadly combination of heat and humidity. Here's how long they lasted

image.altText: A car covered by a blue tarp has broken windows and is surrounded by fallen tree branches on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A woman has died on the Victoria-New South Wales border and downed trees have cut power to tens of thousands of Victorian properties after wild winds swept the state on Monday.

title.children: Woman dies after tree falls on cabin, thousands without power

image.altText: Three women in a kitchen

props.synopsis: In a region with soaring dialysis rates, these Aboriginal women are brewing traditional bush medicine to bring comfort.

title.children: In a region with soaring dialysis rates, these Aboriginal women are using bush medicine to ease pain

image.altText: A man in glasses, China's ambassador to the Pacific nations Qian Bo, wearing a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: The Pacific's top regional body has denied it has buckled to Chinese pressure by deleting a line about Taiwan in a communique issued by leaders late last week, suggesting instead that an administrative error is to blame instead.

title.children: Pacific officials say error to blame for 'deeply unfortunate' Taiwan reference that angered China

image.altText: Jim Chalmers wears a navy suit, looking solemnly off camera.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers has blamed successive interest rate rises for "smashing the economy", as the government braces for more weak economic figures due this week.

title.children: Expecting bad economic news, Chalmers blames interest rate rises for 'smashing' economy

image.altText: two bodies on a tiled floor covered with Palestinian flags, surrounded by mourners.

props.synopsis: The daily reality in the West Bank is that settlers or soldiers are able to threaten or kill unarmed Palestinians knowing that as long as they say they felt threatened they will face no real accountability.

title.children: Israel's conduct in the West Bank has worried even some in Israel

image.altText: A closeup of Greens party member Max Chandler-Mather at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The Greens will also push for permanent rent control if they hold the balance of power in the next parliament.

title.children: Greens add 'landlord watchdog' to growing housing policy wish list

image.altText: Anthony Albanese confused in QT

props.synopsis: Only 24 per cent of Australians surveyed in a new poll could name a single thing that had made their lives better since the Albanese government was elected.

title.children: One stark number tells the story of why Albanese wants to stop talking about culture wars

image.altText: A man in flannel puts his arm around a woman in a puffer jacket in a backyard. They look dejected

props.synopsis: Predatory lowball cash settlements from insurance companies to victims of flood damage are a serious issue, with the peak body for financial counsellors revealing underquoting is rife.

title.children: The Haimeses had 'gold insurance cover' but when their house flooded, they nearly fell victim to a common trap
